configurationId-path.description: A unique identifier for a CAC configuration.
configurationId-path.name: configurationId

version-path.description: The version of proposed CIDR blocks that you are acknowledging.
version-path.name: version

configuration.description: Encapsulates the Client Access Control (CAC) configurations that you have access to. These configurations let your origin communicate with the Akamai network.

configurationId.description: The unique ID for the CAC configuration.

currentCidrs.description: Encapsulates the current set of CIDR blocks.

acknowledgeDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp for when your organization last acknowledged a proposed CIDR block version.

cidrs.description: CIDR blocks used to provide this CAC configuration with access to the Akamai portal.

version.description: The current version of CIDR blocks serving the CAC configuration. The first version is always `0`.

description.description: A description of the CAC configuration.

name.description: The name of the CAC configuration.

proposedCidrs.description: Encapsulates the set of CIDR blocks proposed by Akamai.

cidrs.description: CIDR blocks used to provide this CAC configuration with access to the Akamai portal.

proposedDate.description: The time, in ISO 8601 format, that Akamai proposed the latest version of CIDR blocks.

version.description: The latest version of CIDR blocks proposed.

version.description: The current version of CIDR blocks serving the CAC configuration. The first version is always `0`.

description.description: A description of the CAC configuration.

name.description: The name of the CAC configuration.

proposedCidrs.description: Encapsulates the set of CIDR blocks proposed by Akamai.

cidrs.description: CIDR blocks used to provide this CAC configuration with access to the Akamai portal.

proposedDate.description: The time, in ISO 8601 format, that Akamai proposed the latest version of CIDR blocks.

version.description: The latest version of CIDR blocks proposed.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Client Access Control API

info.description:
Restrict access between your origin infrastructure and
Akamai edge servers based on CIDR blocks.
info.title: Akamai: Client Access Control API

get.description: Get the list of all Client Access Control (CAC) configurations to which you have access.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Client Access Control API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

example.description: The CAC configuration for an example application.
example.name: Example-CAC-Config

put.description: Once you review the `proposedCidrs` from Akamai and update your Access Control List (ACL) accordingly, use this operation to acknowledge the change.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Client Access Control API
